result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A Ruisch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary A Ruisch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary A Ruisch was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber for childcare. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Court order for intoxicated driver assessment and driver safety plan.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
2:15 PM Defendant Zachary A Ruisch in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Zachary A Ruisch.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defense indicates they are ready to enter into a plea and go to sentencing today. Makes statements on the record. Defense indicates the parties explored Veteran's Court but are ultimately back here. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer is correct. 
Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 22CM629
Plea - Ct. 1: GUILTY
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis.
BTC: GUILTY. Ct. 2 is dismissed outright. Cts. 3 and 4 are dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 4 months Racine County Jail; HUBER for childcare
24 month driver's license revocation;
24 month Ignition Interlock Device;
6 points against driver's license; 
AODA ;
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$600 fine+ Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge+ IID Surcharge, Payment Plan $50/month commencing: December 1, 2022

***DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY*** 

BTC: Case 21TR4763 is dismissed.

10:04 AM Defendant Zachary A Ruisch in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Zachary A Ruisch.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defense makes statements on the record and is seeking a plea and sentencing date. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.

9:55 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary A Ruisch in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Zachary A Ruisch. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Defendant indicates he has served in the military.
Court indicates the defendant may be eligible for Veterans Court and sets this matter over to allow Defendant time to complete application. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Retainer- Atty Conner Helvig for Zachary Ruisch

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all.   Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. NO EXCEPTION FOR PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION: SUBUTEX, ADDERALL, LORAZAPAM AND GABAPENTIN. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**Amended on 12-11-20:  Defendant may look for work as an exception, if employment is obtained must provide schedule to RCAP.  Verified medical appointment are also an exception.**

**Amended on 7-6-21:  House arrest and GPS can be removed.  Defendant is allowed to take prescription medications, must provide prescriptions to RCAP, Do not abuse prescriptions, take as prescribed.**

11:07 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Zachary A Ruisch in court.  Attorney Conner Helvig in court for Zachary A Ruisch. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard. 
 Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set. $500 cash bond to be transferred to this case from the 20CF1087.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
